name: Moon

phases.new_moon: Moon is between Earth and Sun

fun_facts: The Moon always shows the same face to Earth.
Moonquakes exist and can last up to 30 minutes.
Footprints on the Moon can last millions of years.
The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth.
description_short: Earth’s only natural satellite and the fifth largest moon in the Solar System.
description_long: The Moon plays a crucial role in stabilizing Earth’s axial tilt and driving ocean tides. It formed approximately 4.5 billion years ago, likely from debris resulting from a massive collision between Earth and a Mars-sized body. The Moon has no significant atmosphere, leading to extreme temperature variations and a heavily cratered surface.
